comments:
This is decently difficult to get.  If you are using field access in an Entity and you add a new field to the class by typing in the source code, you can get this NPE.  You have to type the letters at just the perfect speed to type a second letter before the persistence model has updated but after the java event for the first lett you typed was sent out.  somewhere around a half second between letters seem to cause this exception to occur.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.dali.core.util.jdt.ASTTools.getAnnotation(ASTTools.java:101)
at org.eclipse.dali.orm.adapters.java.JavaPersistentAttributeModelAdapter.getAnnotation(JavaPersistentAttributeModelAdapter.java:235)

at org.eclipse.dali.orm.impl.PersistenceFileImpl.handleEvent(PersistenceFileImpl.java:201)
This should be un-targeted since we can't commit to fixing it in 1.0.

The exception has changed, but I think the underlying problem is the same.
